snippet.textDisplay: I'm thinking. Metroid Prime 3 maybe left the traditional "Playbyfindimgnewstufftokillbigbadboss" but it is the best Metroid Game so far. Beautiful Designs, planets and music; fleshed out factions, the best console FPS controller. The few tiny gimmicks aren't even a fraction of the problem people make them out to be.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm thinking. Metroid Prime 3 maybe left the traditional "Playbyfindimgnewstufftokillbigbadboss" but it is the best Metroid Game so far. Beautiful Designs, planets and music; fleshed out factions, the best console FPS controller. The few tiny gimmicks aren't even a fraction of the problem people make them out to be.

snippet.textDisplay: I came into the Metroid series very late - with Corruption. So many fond memories. Like when I first beat Mogenar, god that was a fist pump moment. I only managed to beat it on a small tv in a rented flat in Southend-On-Sea - then it entered my backlog until trilogy came out. Finished prime. Still ain't finished the otherfirst person ones or Super Metriod - ain't even bought Other M - but of what I played, these games are the Chozo's Feathers :3
snippet.textOriginal: I came into the Metroid series very late - with Corruption. So many fond memories. Like when I first beat Mogenar, god that was a fist pump moment. I only managed to beat it on a small tv in a rented flat in Southend-On-Sea - then it entered my backlog until trilogy came out. Finished prime. Still ain't finished the otherfirst person ones or Super Metriod - ain't even bought Other M - but of what I played, these games are the Chozo's Feathers :3

snippet.textDisplay: No true Metroid fan enjoyed Other M. Nintendo put the map in to sell Other M. They stopped producing the game months after release because of the horrible sales. That's why, when you see it in retail (where I live) it's about $84 CND. Which is a lot more expensive than AAA games that just come out.

snippet.textDisplay:
Prime 1 was awesome and is still on of my favorites of all time. Prime 2 pretty hard on the normal mode on the GCN (for casual gamers) but it still had the great feeling of Metroid which was lost on Prime 3, where you're only straight forward adventuring through some areas only to never revisit them ever again. 

for me it's clearly 1>2>3
snippet.textOriginal:
Prime 1 was awesome and is still on of my favorites of all time. Prime 2 pretty hard on the normal mode on the GCN (for casual gamers) but it still had the great feeling of Metroid which was lost on Prime 3, where you're only straight forward adventuring through some areas only to never revisit them ever again. 

for me it's clearly 1>2>3

snippet.textDisplay:
@kricku
You hope? that I am asking? or I'm agreeing?  Well I'm not askign but everyone has heir own opinion and can state it. And for agreeing..surely not.
As you can guess form my comment I like action. And the "fighting" if you want to cll it liek that definitely was the best in 3. best bosses, the battles felt smooth and the gameplay was good. As I said I get thatmany metroid fans particularly like the exploration factor and MP§ defenitely lacks there..but to me that is not a bad thing.
As for 2...it is jst clearly the wirst of the bunch for me.  The dark world gets very tedious in the end, except from Quadraxis the battles are unmemorable to even just being annoying and frustrating. MP2 is till a "good" game, but surely lacks to much on every end to be as great as the other 2.
Again as for 1 and 3, I'm totally aware that that is a thing of what you prefer in a game of that kind.
snippet.textOriginal:
@kricku
You hope? that I am asking? or I'm agreeing?  Well I'm not askign but everyone has heir own opinion and can state it. And for agreeing..surely not.
As you can guess form my comment I like action. And the "fighting" if you want to cll it liek that definitely was the best in 3. best bosses, the battles felt smooth and the gameplay was good. As I said I get thatmany metroid fans particularly like the exploration factor and MP§ defenitely lacks there..but to me that is not a bad thing.
As for 2...it is jst clearly the wirst of the bunch for me.  The dark world gets very tedious in the end, except from Quadraxis the battles are unmemorable to even just being annoying and frustrating. MP2 is till a "good" game, but surely lacks to much on every end to be as great as the other 2.
Again as for 1 and 3, I'm totally aware that that is a thing of what you prefer in a game of that kind.

snippet.textDisplay: @TravistheGREAT03 1>=2>3 if you ask me and I hope you do. Prime 3 literally has a Cortana barking orders complete with gruff general-man and all. Prime 3 is dumb
snippet.textOriginal: @TravistheGREAT03 1>=2>3 if you ask me and I hope you do. Prime 3 literally has a Cortana barking orders complete with gruff general-man and all. Prime 3 is dumb

snippet.textDisplay: @Dane Tucker If you liked Prime 1, Prime 2 is a very similar game. I'd say Prime 2 is a bit tougher than the first game, and you have to be patient as the transitions between Aether and Dark Aether take a while (and there are a lot of them throughout the game), but it's still a very good game. Prime 3 I would say is almost as amazing as Prime 1, and while Prime 2 was almost the exact same formula as Prime 1, Prime 3 makes some nice changes to the format, so I'd definitely recommend Prime 3 as well.
snippet.textOriginal: @Dane Tucker If you liked Prime 1, Prime 2 is a very similar game. I'd say Prime 2 is a bit tougher than the first game, and you have to be patient as the transitions between Aether and Dark Aether take a while (and there are a lot of them throughout the game), but it's still a very good game. Prime 3 I would say is almost as amazing as Prime 1, and while Prime 2 was almost the exact same formula as Prime 1, Prime 3 makes some nice changes to the format, so I'd definitely recommend Prime 3 as well.

snippet.textDisplay: I was just as disappointed as most of you when Federation Force was unveiled, wondering if Nintendo really thought the reception would be anything but negative after the fanbase asked for a new Metroid game for so long. It looks like a good concept they decided to slap the Metroid name on. On a more positive note, I'm not worried the game will be good since Next Level Games are very competent. I'm also pretty sure a real Metroid game is currently in the works and will be unveiled not much later.
snippet.textOriginal: I was just as disappointed as most of you when Federation Force was unveiled, wondering if Nintendo really thought the reception would be anything but negative after the fanbase asked for a new Metroid game for so long. It looks like a good concept they decided to slap the Metroid name on. On a more positive note, I'm not worried the game will be good since Next Level Games are very competent. I'm also pretty sure a real Metroid game is currently in the works and will be unveiled not much later.
